image.altText: A woman with brown short hair sits behind a microphone

items.synopsis: Senior public servant Kathryn Campbell resigns from the Department of Defence after coming under heavy criticism for her role in the Robodebt scandal.

title.children: Senior public servant in Robodebt scheme resigns from Department of Defence

image.altText: Iceberg in the Southern Ocean, seen from a ship.

items.synopsis: Antarctic sea ice has usually been able to recover in winter. But this time it's different, with levels taking a sharp downward turn at a time of year when sea ice usually forms reliably — and experts are worried.

title.children: A once in every 7.5 million year event is unfolding in the Antarctic. And it has scientists scrambling for answers

image.altText: Gladys Berejiklian looking serious.

items.synopsis: ICAC inspector Gail Furness SC has written to former treasurer Matt Kean to advise him of the investigation after he wrote a letter complaining about the former premier's treatment last month, the ABC understands.

title.children: ICAC chief to probe delay in Gladys Berejiklian report, possible maladministration

image.altText: Wicks is standing in her place, holding a piece of paper and looking towards the Speaker (not in shot).

items.synopsis: The former federal MP for Robertson names herself at the centre of allegations about alleged abuse by a "NSW member of parliament spanning more than 5 years".

title.children: Liberal Party figure Lucy Wicks claims she received hundreds of 'abusive' texts from NSW MP

image.altText: a skyline with houses

items.synopsis: A new report from campaign group Everybody's Home finds 80 per cent of renters are spending more than a third of their income on housing.

title.children: Majority of Australians living under 'housing stress', survey finds

image.altText: Dave Brown, wearing a bright yellow jacket, a dark cap and backpack, smiles at the camera as snow falls around him.

items.synopsis: Tasmanian paramedic Dave has been following the war in Ukraine — now he and a colleague will go to the front line, hoping to make a difference.

title.children: Paramedic Dave hoping skills learned in Tasmania will assist in upcoming mercy mission to Ukraine

image.altText: Gina Rinehart smiles while standing in front of cattle pens

items.synopsis: The descendants of late mining magnate Peter Wright claim they are entitled to a bigger share of iron ore royalties based on an agreement struck with Lang Hancock in the 1970s, the WA Supreme Court hears.

title.children: Here's what happened on day one of the long-awaited showdown between mining heiresses

image.altText: A crashed car against a barrier with police attending.

items.synopsis: A man who police allege stole a car before it was involved in a triple fatal crash on the Sunshine Coast has more driving charges laid against him.

title.children: Driver hit with more charges after horror Queensland highway crash killed three

image.altText: A German striker grins as she runs toward a teammate in celebration after a goal.

items.synopsis: Germany takes control with two first-half goals against debutants Morocco in Melbourne, after a pulsating encounter between Italy and Argentina ends in victory for Le Azurre in Auckland. Follow along in our live blog.

title.children: Germany in control against Morocco after Italy leaves it late at Eden Park

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Popp is claiming it, hard to tell, it was bundled over the line by about five players. These goals keep getting messier. I'll leave it to people getting paid a lot more to me to decide who scored that.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 79' Germany has another goal

children.content: Popp is claiming it, hard to tell, it was bundled over the line by about five players.
I'll leave it to people getting paid a lot more to me to decide who scored that.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The ball was whipped across the face of goal and Hanane Ait El Haj could do nothing but knock it into her own net. This is getting messy now.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 55' Own goal Morocco! It's Germany 4-0

props.alt: Moroccan player with hands on her head

children.content: The ball was whipped across the face of goal and
Hanane Ait El Haj could do nothing but knock it into her own net.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Klara Buehl makes a bust down the left and crosses, after a bit of pinball in the box she finishes it herself. 23 seconds after the restart.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 46' AAAAAND that's 3-0

children.content: Klara Buehl makes a bust down the left and crosses, after a bit of pinball in the box she finishes it herself.

image.altText: two public housing towers can be seen with the Melbourne city skyline in the background

items.synopsis: Melbourne public housing tower residents will receive compensation payments of about $2,200 each from the Victorian government after they were forced into a sudden hard lockdown during a COVID-19 outbreak in 2020.

title.children: Melbourne public housing tower residents agree to $5m COVID lockdown settlement

image.altText: A night time photo of a Queensland Police Service car with its blue light illuminated.

items.synopsis: Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll says a small cohort of offenders are committing more crime and and it's more violent than before.

title.children: 'Phenomenal' arrest figures as 14,000 charges laid in Queensland police operation targetting young offenders

image.altText: An illustration of a woman crouched on a hospital bed with her head in her arms

items.synopsis: Too many women are leaving mental health units in a worse condition than when they arrived, with some in mixed-gender wards reporting shocking treatment that has left them reluctant to seek further care.

title.children: When Maree was sexually assaulted in a mental health unit, staff responded by telling her to stay on her bed

image.altText: Men on a machine picking veg.

items.synopsis: More than 200 Pacific workers have been left in limbo after their employer Linx Employment agreed to end its participation in the Pacific Australia Labour Mobility scheme amid worker treatment investigations.

title.children: Pacific workers in Tasmania, Queensland in limbo as large employer quits PALM scheme

image.altText: smiling older man looking at camera

items.synopsis: Good Samaritan Terry Bishop had been travelling to Brisbane on Friday to attend a family member's wedding. Family members say he was a man who would go out of his way to help anyone.

title.children: 'Absolutely devastated': Bruce Highway triple-fatal victim Terry Bishop had been travelling to family wedding

image.altText: A man in a bucket hat rubs his face in frustration.

items.synopsis: England captain Ben Stokes says anyone who believes the team should have declared earlier at Old Trafford 'doesn't understand the game', as Australia retain the Ashes.

title.children: Stokes bristles at declaration critics and reveals his one regret as England fail to claim the Ashes back

image.altText: Woman with short hair looks upset while wearing black suit

items.synopsis: The justice minister says she was facing "personal difficulties" when she allegedly crashed into a parked car.

title.children: New Zealand minister resigns after crash while allegedly over alcohol limit

image.altText: An aerial view of wreckage of a school gymnasium in China

items.synopsis: Chinese state media reports a volcanic glass roof over a school gym collapsed, trapping a female volleyball team, with the heads of the company who installed the roof taken into custody.

title.children: Entire school gym roof collapses, killing 11 and trapping one

image.altText: A black and white image of crowns being placed on a man and woman's heads

items.synopsis: Juan Carlos was once a handsome young king who saved Spain from tyranny. Now disgraced and living in exile, his son Felipe dreads his potential return.

title.children: 'Always embarrassed by his father': Why Spain's King Felipe is dreading his disgraced dad's return

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit pushes his fingertips together onstage in front of a black and white backdrop.

items.synopsis: Twitter owner Elon Musk announces a name change for Twitter as chief executive Linda Yaccarino says the company is looking forward to bringing X to the world.

title.children: Twitter to rebrand to X and drop blue bird, Musk says

image.altText: A ranger sets up a beach closed sign after a shark attack.

items.synopsis: Fisheries authorities are responding after a surfer was bitten by a great white shark near Gnarabup, in Western Australia's South West, this morning.

title.children: Authorities investigating after man bitten by shark at popular WA surf spot

image.altText: Stan Grant appears on Q+A.

items.synopsis: Veteran host Stan Grant has decided to step away from presenting Q+A. Patricia Karvelas will continue as host of the program for the rest of the year.

title.children: Stan Grant departs from Q+A

image.altText: two men in military style uniforms look up at damaged high rise building

items.synopsis: Ukraine has not claimed responsibility for alleged drone attacks which damaged office buildings in the Russian capital.

title.children: Buildings damaged in Moscow as Russia accuses Ukraine of 'terrorist' drone attack

image.altText: People wearing spotlights on small boats in the water near the shoreline search for survivors.

items.synopsis: The boat was designed to carry 20 people but 48 passengers packed onto the vessel, which capsized just after midnight.

title.children: Overloaded Indonesian ferry sinks at night, killing 15

image.altText: A white car crashed on the highway

items.synopsis: A crime scene has been established on the Princes Highway on NSW's south coast after a man died and two other adults were injured in a two-vehicle crash.

title.children: Man dies in highway crash, traffic affected in both directions

image.altText: A young woman with red hair is comforted by an older blonde woman

items.synopsis: A 20-year-old has different priorities in life than an 80-year-old. So why do we assume their priorities in death are the same?

title.children: Why young people with life-limiting illnesses need special end-of-life care

image.altText: An animated image of a hand putting recycling into a yellow-lidded bin.

items.synopsis: From how clean your recycling needs to be to how many donated clothes are actually resold — can you sort your waste facts from fiction.

title.children: Are you an expert recycler? Test your skills with our War On Waste quiz

image.altText: Three women in bright coloured dresses walk along Romes streets with foldable fans

items.synopsis: Record breaking high temperatures are set to continue for Europe and the US in August, experts warn.

title.children: Here's what we know about extreme heat continuing to grip much of the world

image.altText: An aerial photo showing a Navy ship in the open ocean, with a military jet flying overhead.

items.synopsis: An aerial photograph obtained by the ABC shows an RAAF P-8 Poseidon plane flying over a Chinese surveillance ship as it headed towards Australia last week.

title.children: First image emerges of Australia's encounter with Chinese spy ship

image.altText: Yevgeny Prigozhin's face is illuminated by a streetlight as he partially smiles through the window of a car, rolled down

items.synopsis: Russia has long been a "paramilitarised" regime, where the state can be challenged and undermined by paramilitary or criminal groups but not completely destroyed, writes Mark Edele.

title.children: Has Putin contained the Prigozhin and Wagner threat?

image.altText: Diego Castor holds the A-League Premiers Plate trophy above his head with his Perth Glory teammates behind him

items.synopsis: Perth Glory players and staff are expected to continue to work as usual amid the search for a new owner for the A-League club, with foreign investment not being ruled out.

title.children: Warning next owners of embattled Perth Glory could be asked to stump up $25 million

image.altText: A man walks in a heavily damaged cathedral

items.synopsis: A Russian missile attack on Ukraine's southern port of Odesa kills one, injures 20 and severely damages an Orthodox cathedral in the city centre, a UNESCO world heritage site, according to President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title.children: World heritage-listed cathedral badly damaged in Russian missile strikes on Odesa
